attributes.action: Allow primary school children to wear face masks at school time due to COVID19.
attributes.additional_details:
Current government guidance doesn’t allow young children below 11 years old to wear face mask at school.
Wearing a face masks doesn’t affect other children or adults’s benefits; doesn’t hurt any people. It actually protects children and their families, specially those with vulnerable at home.
If wearing face masks can’t be allowed, then children and their parents should be allowed to choose school learning or home learning during COVID19 as Government can’t effectively stop transmission.
attributes.background:
Government and schools should allow parents to decide if their children should wear face masks.
Those trained children to manage face masks effectively should be allowed to make their own decisions of their children wearing face masks at school with their own responsibilities.
